result.execSummary:
All charges against Timothy Lamar Clayton in this case have been dismissed. These charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Timothy Lamar Clayton is presumed innocent.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

chargeModifiers.descr: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Timothy Lamar Clayton

records.addlTxt:
Attorney Michael Jude appeared by video for Timothy Lamar Clayton.  Attorney James C Griffin in court for State of Wisconsin. 

Parties inform the court that defendant is deceased.  Court ordered case DISMISSED.
Justice Point Discharge Report, filed.
See waiver of preliminary hearing entry.

Defendant Timothy Lamar Clayton in court.  Attorney Michael Jude in court for Timothy Lamar Clayton.  Prosecuting attorney James C Griffin in court for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing.  Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed.  Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial. Defense acknowledges receipt of the Information, waives reading and enters a plea of not guilty on behalf of his client. Case is adjourned in Branch 02.
Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for November 11, 2022 at 10:30 am.
Received and Filed.

Attorney Michael Jude in court, defendant Timothy Lamar Clayton not in court, in custody at HOC.  Abby Rockendorf appeared in person for the State of Wisconsin.
Case is set for a Preliminary Hearing. State's Witness is present. Defense requests adjournment to trial court. Defendant in the process of drug treatment placement. Courts grants request. Court orders case adjourned for CAUSE for a  Status Conference.  Status conference scheduled for September 14, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Timothy Lamar Clayton not in court, defendant in custody.  Arthur Kenneth Thexton appeared in person for the State of Wisconsin.
Case set for a preliminary hearing. State's witness is present. Case adjourned due to non appearance of counsel.  Court ordered case adjourned for CAUSE for a Preliminary Hearing in Preliminary Hearing Court, Room 146 of the Criminal Justice Facility.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for August 22, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Timothy Lamar Clayton not in court, defendant in custody.  Gregg Herman appeared in person for the State of Wisconsin. 
Case set for a preliminary hearing. Attorney Michael Jude in trial this week. Court ordered case adjourned for CAUSE for a Preliminary Hearing in Preliminary Hearing Court, Room 146 of the Criminal Justice Facility.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for August 9, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Attorney Michael Jude in court, defendant Timothy Lamar Clayton not in court, in custody, appearance wavied.  James C Griffin appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Court orders $200 cash bail. Turnover to justice point level 5 supervision. No contact with Walgreens in Shorewood. Case is adjourned for a preliminary hearing.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for July 25, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Defendant missed court on 04-01-2022.  Defendant has been picked up on warrant and is currently in custody. Case is adjourned for a Return on Warrant on 07-14-2022 at 8:30 am.  Parties notified.

Defendant Timothy Lamar Clayton not in court, defendant in custody.  Anna Marie Meulbroek appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Case set for a preliminary hearing. States witness is present. Attorney Jude does not appear. Defendant Timothy Lamar Clayton in court with attorney Ashley Fard.  Defendant Timothy Lamar Clayton in custody.  Matthew Richard Westphal appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Timothy Lamar Clayton appeared by video means with Attorney.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Childs, Branch 02.  Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.  Defense enters a plea of NOT GUILTY as to misdemeanor count 2.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  
This hearing will be streamed live on Dacast:  https://iframe.dacast.com/live/4dafbf46-ed15-c11c-fa22-a58262833632/99073afd-37c2-acfa-830d-b1ddcaebf0ea  Preliminary hearing scheduled for March 9, 2022 at 08:30 am.
COURT ORDERED DEFENDANT REMANDED TO THE COMMISSIONER ON RETURN OF THE ARREST WARRANT.
We did issue the WARRANT defendant failed to appear. I had to cancel the authorized Warrant to issue the actual warrant.

Defendant Timothy Lamar Clayton not in court.  Allysa Bria Brown appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant failing to appear, Court ordered an Arrest Warrant to be issued. Upon arrest, defendant is ordered remanded to a commissioner. Court ordered any bail on deposit to be forfeited. Court makes a finding that there is a possible victim identified and stays the forfeiture order with restitution to be determined at close of case.

Attorney Michael Jude in court.  Catelin Ringersma appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant failing to appear, court ordered arrest warrant issued but STAYED issuance until 2-09-2022 at 1:30pm in Br. OCCR. 
  Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for February 9, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
